text: The 1959 Pan American Games were held in Chicago, Illinois, United States between August 28 and September 7, 1959. The event was opened by Milton S. Eisenhower, the brother of U.S. President Dwight D. Eisenhower.The Spokesman- Review - Google News Archive Search It was held at Soldier Field. The United States won the most medals winning 121 gold medals and a total of 252 medals. Argentina and Canada came in second and third place. ==References== Category:Pan American Games Category:1959 in North America Category:1950s in the United States Category:20th century in Chicago
title: 1959 Pan American Games
